McGrath, a lawyer, banker and real-estate developer who served as New York City's Corporation Counsel and as a member of the Waterfront Commission of New York and New Jersey, died yesterday at Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center after a long illness. title: John P. McGrath, 82, Lawyer, Banker and Developer, Is Dead

body: LEAD: With New York City moving ahead in its plan to stop using welfare hotels to shelter homeless families, Mayor Edward I. body: LEAD: A green van with a city seal on the side stopped in front of the welfare hotel on West 104th Street, and seven women and one man got in. title: One of the Things New York City Is Doing for the Homeless Mentally Ill

title: Koch Affirmative-Action Program Used for Patronage, Panel Is Told
